question: False about Turner's syndrome are all except:
exp: The question is asking about true statement about Turner's syndrome out of all options. Only Normal intelligence is true and while all other options provide a false explanation of Turner's syndrome as explained below: Turner syndrome Genotype is X0 Female is affected Only monosomy compatible with life Have zero Barr bodies (A normal female has one Barr body) Intelligence is normal

question: Which of the following trinucleotide repeat disorder and the repeat is wrongly paired?
exp: Disease Repeat Fragile X syndrome CGG Friedreich's Ataxia GAA Myotonic dystrophy CTG Spinobulbar muscular atrophy (Kennedy disease), Spinocerebellar ataxia, Huntington's disease CAG

question: Barr body is not present in female having- (PGMEE 2012-13)
exp: In Turner syndrome (45, XO),one of the X-chromosome is missing in a female. This is the most lethal karyotype. It is only monosomy of sex chromosome in humans. There are 45 chromosomes instead of 46 in a normal individual. Phenotype Genotype Barr bodies Normal Male XY 0 (Normal) Normal Female XX 1 (Normal) Turner Syndrome X0 0 (Female with no Barr Body) Klinfelter Syndrome XXY 1 (Male with Barr Body) Super Female XXX 2 (Female with two Barr Bodies) No. of Barr bodies = no. of x chromosome - 1 Since in XO genotype there is 1 x chromosome. Therefore, no. of barr bodies is 1-1=0

question: Inheritance of Beckers muscular dystrophy is?
exp: Beckers muscular dystrophy is X-linked recessive disorder. Diseases which are XR (X-linked recessive) : Color blindness Duchenne's Muscular Dystrophy Becker's Muscular Dystrophy Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase deficiency(G6PD) Testicular Feminization Fragile X-Syndrome Hunter's Syndrome Fabry's disease Ornithine Transcarboxylase deficiency Lesch Nyhan syndrome Hemophilia A and B Agammaglobulinemia

question: All of the following diseases are due to excessive number of glutamine residues in proteins, EXCEPT
exp: CAG codes for glutamine Poly Q disorders Those diseases which are due to CAG repeat Eg : Spinobulbar muscular atrophy (Kennedy disease), Spinocerebellar ataxia Huntington's disease Myotonic dystrophy is due to | CTG repeat, not CAG.

question: Cat eye syndrome is:
exp: Cat eye syndrome Defect in chromosome number 22 sho arm (p) and a small section of the long arm (q) of chromosome 22 is present 3-4 times instead of the usual 2 times. C/F: Unilateral/bilateral iris coloboma Anal atresia Cleft palate Sho stature Hernias Renal abnormalities

question: In 1990, for the first time, Michaele Blease and W. French Andresco of National Institute of Health, Bethesda, U.S.A. attempted gene therapy on a human patient. Which of the following disease was attempted to be cured?
exp: The first convincing therapeutic effect from gene transfer occurred with : SCID Impoant types of defects in SCID: X-linked Severe Combined Immunodeficiency Disease (SCID): mutations in the gene (IL2RG). IL2RG encodes gc subunit of cytokine receptors. Inheritance pattern: X-Linked. Most common defect in SCID patientsQ. Most common cause of SCID is IL2R defect. Autosomal Recessive SCID: ADA (Adenosine Deaminase enzyme) deficiency. gene therapy is done for ADA deficiency SCID.

question: Hypophosphatemic Vitamin D Resistant Rickets is?
exp: X-linked dominant (XD) inheritance : 1. Hypophosphatemic Vitamin D Resistant Rickets 2. Alpo syndrome 3. Charcot Marie tooth disease 4. Incontinentia Pigmenti 5.Fragile X- syndrome

question: X- linked recessive disease in male with clotting defect is-
exp: X- linked recessive disease in male with clotting defect is Hemophilia A XR (X-linked recessive) Color blindness Duchenne's Muscular Dystrophy Becker's Muscular Dystrophy Glucose-6-Phosphate Dehydrogenase deficiency(G6PD) Testicular Feminization Hunter's Syndrome Fabry's disease Ornithine Transcarboxylase deficiency Lesch Nyhan syndrome Hemophilia A and B Agammaglobulinemia
